course_title: Advanced clinical skills in sports and exercise physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced skills in analysis of movement and design of programs to address movement deficiencies and optimise movement for sport and exercise.
Demonstrate advanced skills and clinical reasoning in exercise testing and programming through rehabilitation, return to sport/exercise and return to performance.

Understand the roles and contributions of multi-disciplinary health and sport professionals in maintaining well-being and preventing and managing acute, persistent and recurrent injuries in sports teams and athletes.
Understand ethical and population-specific considerations, including age, sex, gender, culture, disability and high performance, in the prevention and management of sports injuries and conditions.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess practical physiotherapy skills in a practical station exam.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess students understanding of course content in a case-based online written exam. This assessment task is to be completed online.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a sport and deliver an individual oral presentation that presents their analysis of a fundamental skill or movement which is a key component of the sport (i.e., a tennis serve, volleyball spike, rugby tackle, the eggbeater kick in water polo, etc…), and discusses the management of a specific injury typically associated with the task.

The oral presentations will be delivered online.

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1. (Assessment Procedure (95) )

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom O-week To Week 1(16 Feb - 01 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Preparation for Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy

Students will watch a series of online lectures in preparation for their practical sports and exercise physiotherapy skills sessions and interactive discussions on topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy.
learning_activities.topic_title: Preparation for Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparation for Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy Students will watch a series of online lectures in preparation for their practical sports and exercise physiotherapy skills sessions and interactive discussions on topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 3(02 Mar - 15 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy

Students will learn practical sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy.
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Skills and Topics in Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy Students will learn practical sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 10(09 Mar - 10 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Sports Analysis Presentation Feedback

Staff will provide feedback on the progress of your sports analysis presentation. During this session you will receive feedback on your planning and development of your sports analysis presentation from staff and your peers. You are also expected to provide feedback to your peers on their planning and development of their presentations.
